book.of.utilities 1.1.1
  • Reference

    Create an Entry into a Development Log

    log_note.Rd

    log_note serves as a wrapper for cat and provides an easy way to write to a plain-text file Even though the original use-case is the real-time capturing of developer notes, it can be used for incremental writing to a file when needed.

    Usage

    log_note(..., file = "", show = FALSE, append = TRUE)

    Arguments

    ...

    (dots_list): The string(s) of text to write to the file. Multiple values are collapsed into a single string separated by a newline. Expressions are allowed and will have the captured output included.

    file

    (string|"") The name of the file to (over)write. If no file is given, the output is sent to the console.

    show

    (logical | FALSE) When TRUE, print the contents of file (requires library readtext).

    append

    (logical | TRUE) When TRUE new content is appended.

    Value

    See parameter show

    On this page
